title: Lyft Prices IPO at $72, Surviving Uber Fundraising Battle
summary: Ride-hailer to launch IPO Friday, overcoming much-larger rival's attempts to starve it of capital. Many thought Lyft Inc., long the ride-hailing underdog, was doomed as it battled a cutthroat rival in an industry where the winner would take all. Now it's a Wall Street darling valued at $24 billion.

title: California Lawmakers Look to Reform College Admissions After Scandal
summary: Bills would make it more difficult for purported athletes, children of donors and alumni to gain admittance to public universities. California lawmakers proposed a package of bills Thursday that includes making it harder for students designated as athletes and children of alumni and donors to get preferential admissions at state universities.

title: The Two Americas Have Grown Much Fiercer
summary: The U.S. was divided 46 years ago. But no one saw it as a fight to the death.. Sometimes you write about the most obvious thing in the world because it is the most important thing. Reaction to the outcome of Robert Mueller's investigation shows Americans again how divided we are. If you are more or less of the left, you experienced the probe as a search for truth that would restore the previous world of politics. Instead the traitor got away with it and you feel destabilized, deflated. If you are of the Trumpian right, it was from the beginning an attempted coup, the establishment using everything it had to remove a force it could not defeat at the polls. You are energized, elated.

title: Steve Moore for the Fed
summary: If making wrong forecasts is a problem, he has lots of company.. Congratulations to our former colleague, Steve Moore. President Trump's decision to nominate him to be a Federal Reserve board member has triggered a remarkable cascade of derision and condescension from the political left and the poohbahs of the economics academy. Sounds like he's the right man for the job.

title: New York's Pied-à-Terre Politics
summary: The latest money grab would crash the luxury real-estate market.. Another day, another scramble for more tax revenue in progressive America. The latest episode in New York City is worth noting because it illustrates America's current politics of envy and the illusion that soaking the rich has no economic consequences.

title: Meet the ObamaCare Bulls
summary: A merger shows how much big insurers love big government.. The odds that the Supreme Court will overturn ObamaCare are long, and at least one major health insurer is making a bullish bet on government health care. Witness Centene 's $17.3 billion acquisition of WellCare, which will make it among the nation's largest providers of government-sponsored health plans.

title: The Case for Medicare for All
summary: You'd be able to keep your doctor with no premiums or copays, and overall spending would decline.. A single-payer health-insurance system can finance good-quality coverage for all U.S. residents while still reducing overall health-care spending by roughly 10%, according to a study I co-authored last November. All Americans would be able to get care from their chosen providers without having to pay premiums, deductibles or copayments.

title: The U.K.'s Brexit Journey of Self-Discovery
summary: Crises of identity are common in the West, but Britain's came with an impossible deadline.. March 29 was supposed to be Brexit Day. Oops. Now it will be April 12, or May 22, or sometime in December, or perhaps in 2020 or-increasingly plausible if not yet entirely likely-never.

title: Trump Pick for Justice Department No. 3 Official Withdraws From Consideration
summary: Jessie Liu was opposed by antiabortion advocates. President Trump's pick for the Justice Department's No. 3 position is withdrawing from consideration, citing opposition from Republicans over her involvement more than a decade ago in a lawyers group that took pro-abortion-rights positions.

title: The Islamic World's China Blind Spot
summary: Many Muslim states are afraid to criticize Beijing over its repression of Uighurs. After a shooting rampage left dozens of Muslim worshipers dead in Christchurch, New Zealand, the governments of Muslim-majority countries condemned the attack. Some cited Islamophobia as a cause of the violence. This is understandable, but most of the Islamic world remains silent about the world's worst instance of official Islamophobia.

title: A Day at the Office With John, Paul, George, Ringo and Grandpa
summary: Ed Sullivan's grandsons got to meet the Beatles when he took them to work in February 1964.. When you were a child, did your grandfather ever invite you to visit him at work?

title: The Mueller Bitter Enders
summary: The special counsel wraps up his work and opens up another Democratic split.. Democrats are struggling over the direction of their party, and this week things got more complicated. In addition to the splits over the Green Leap Forward, Medicare for All and constitutional rewrites, Robert Mueller's report has opened a new divide. It's Team Reality vs. Team Bitter Enders.

title: 'Infinite Baseball' Review: A Philosopher at the Ballpark
summary: More than a game? Amid the excitement of Opening Day, reflections on how to think about thinking about baseball.. The Library of Congress catalog lists over 4,400 entries under the subject heading of "baseball." It's hard to imagine that any of them begin with an epigraph from Kierkegaard, but Alva Noë's "Infinite Baseball" certainly does: "The goal is to arrive at immediacy after reflection." The epigraph may be unprecedented, but nowadays it's not at all surprising that a Berkeley philosophy professor would turn his attention to baseball.

title: Hollywood Admits Abortion Is Violent
summary: The MPAA gives 'Unplanned' an R rating, fittingly.. When I was young, it was common in Catholic households to find the church's weekly Legion of Decency movie reviews cut out and taped to the refrigerator. Hollywood producers dreaded a C rating-"condemned"-because Catholics would stay away from such films in droves.

title: Morgan Stanley's No. 2 Executive to Retire
summary: Colm Kelleher, Morgan Stanley's president, won't be immediately replaced, the CEO says. Morgan Stanley 's second-in-command, Colm Kelleher, is retiring, opening a seat whose filling will signal the Wall Street firm's likely heir apparent.

title: The 4% Mortgage Is Back
summary: The average rate on a 30-year fixed mortgage was down nearly a quarter point this week from a week earlier, its biggest drop in over a decade. Mortgage rates are fast approaching 4%, a rate low enough that economists and lenders believe it will help jump-start the housing market again.

title: Wheels Come Off Wells Fargo Stagecoach Yet Again
summary: Wells Fargo is still a long way from cleaning up the mess as Tim Sloan steps down. More than two years after its account-sales scandal broke out into the open, Wells Fargo & Co. is still a long way from cleaning up the mess.

title: Albany Legislators Look for Deals as Deadline Looms for State Budget
summary: Talks center on congestion-pricing system to help fund the MTA and efforts to reduce the use of money bail. New York lawmakers spent Thursday engaged in a flurry of last-minute budget negotiations and lobbying on a variety of issues, including congestion pricing to fund the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, public campaign financing and a reduction in the use of cash bail.

title: Mueller Disappoints All the Never Trumpers
summary: In a case where there is no evidence of a crime, providing definitive proof that there actually were no crimes is impossible.. Most in the media grudgingly agree with you that "The Mueller Conclusions" (Review & Outlook, March 25) found no collusion between the 2016 Trump campaign staff and Russia, but that concession was secondary to a more important conclusion that there was insufficient evidence as to whether the president committed some other crime during the Mueller investigation. In a case where there is no evidence of a crime, providing definitive proof that there actually were no crimes is impossible.

title: Wells Fargo CEO Tim Sloan Steps Down
summary: General counsel, C. Allen Parker, will be interim CEO as bank searches externally for permanent chief. Wells Fargo & Co. Chief Executive Tim Sloan stepped down Thursday, ending a 31-year career at the bank and a 2½-year slog to get it back on solid footing after a fake-account scandal badly damaged its reputation and standing with regulators.

title: Many Democrats Don't Mind 'Socialist' Tag
summary: If the Democrats were seriously against the label of socialist, they would vet their candidates and prevent Sen. Sanders from tarnishing their brand. But they don't.. Barry C. Baron (Letters, March 22) objects to the label of "socialist" and admonishes the Journal to stop using that label regarding Democrats. The candidate who gathered the most energy during the 2016 campaign ran in the Democratic Party primaries, and a huge number of voters cast their vote for Bernie Sanders. In the view of many, Bernie should have been the party's nominee except for shenanigans within that party. Sen. Sanders is a self-described democratic socialist. He makes no qualms about the label. And he is running again in 2020.

title: Why Not Have a 'Sunset' for Supervoting Shares?
summary: Let's build in an accountability moment so that shareholders can affirm that continued protection for founders makes sense.. Your editorial "Dueling over Lyft's IPO" (March 23) misses what the Council of Institutional Investors (CII) believes Lyft should have done-"sunset" founder supervoting rights in a reasonable period.

title: Homeowner Associations Do Much Good for Communities
summary: By and large, HOAs are staffed by volunteers who simply want the community to remain the same as when they themselves chose to live in it. If you are unwilling to abide by an HOA's rules, then buy elsewhere.. I have great sympathy for the homeowner association (HOA) in "The $1 Million HOA Blowup Started With the Flower Pots" (page one, March 20). Having lived in housing under HOAs for 25 years, I can tell you that curmudgeons who defy community standards make it difficult for HOAs to do their work. HOAs proliferate in the retirement communities here in Florida, and the legislature has been very supportive of HOAs' authority. By and large, HOAs are staffed by volunteers who simply want the community to remain the same as when they chose to live in it. If you are unwilling to abide by an HOA's rules, then buy elsewhere.

title: The CMS Acknowledges Free Market's Positive Incentives
summary: There remains hope for both taxpayers and consumers when Seema Varma, the esteemed administrator of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, publicly advocates for market incentives in health care.. There remains hope for both taxpayers and consumers when Seema Verma, the esteemed administrator of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, publicly advocates for market incentives in health care ("Medicare for All Means Hope for None," op-ed, March 28). Only the free market simultaneously promotes both quality and, by cost control, availability. Her piece is the first time ever I've seen such sentiments wisely, strongly and correctly articulated by a federal official. Bravo!

title: Dollar Higher on Haven Buying
summary: Investors are seeking a refuge from slowdown concerns. The dollar rose against its peers, as investors sought safety amid worries of a global economic slowdown .

title: HUD Action Against Facebook Signals Trouble for Other Platforms
summary: Department accuses social-media firm of fostering discrimination in advertising based on race, national origin, religion and more. WASHINGTON-Federal officials accused Facebook Inc. Thursday of unlawful discrimination by allowing real-estate companies to target potential customers by race, religion and other factors, and signaled that other online advertising platforms are in its crosshairs.

title: China Floats Cloud Concession to Foreign Tech Firms in U.S. Trade Talks
summary: Under the proposal, foreign providers would be allowed to own data centers as part of a pilot in a free-trade zone. BEIJING-China is offering foreign technology firms better access to the country's fast-growing cloud-computing market, people briefed on the matter said, as Beijing fashions a compromise in a tech sector the U.S. wants opened as part of a trade deal.

title: Baltimore Mayor Apologizes for 'Healthy Holly' Book Deal
summary: Catherine Pugh sold 100,000 books at a cost of $500,000 to university medical system where she sat on board of directors. Baltimore Mayor Catherine Pugh said Thursday she made a mistake selling her self-published "Healthy Holly" children's books to the University of Maryland Medical System, where she sat on the board of directors.

title: Trump Says FBI to Investigate Smollett Case; Chicago Seeks Repayment for Probe
summary: President calls dropping charges an 'embarrassment'; Mayor Emanuel wants actor to say, 'I'm accountable'. CHICAGO-President Trump said he has asked federal law-enforcement agencies to investigate the Jussie Smollett case, while Chicago sent the actor a letter seeking $130,000 in overtime for detectives who worked on the case-and threatened legal action for untimely payment.

title: Trump Reverses Proposal to End Special Olympics Funding
summary: 'I have overridden my people' on the controversial stance, president says. President Trump said Thursday he was reversing his administration's proposal to eliminate federal funding for the Special Olympics, a move that had drawn widespread criticism.

title: Boeing Sued Over Ethiopian Crash
summary: Aerospace giant faces other suits filed by families of passengers following 737 MAX crash last year. The family of a passenger killed in an Ethiopian Airlines crash earlier this month sued Boeing Co. in a U.S. court, broadening the litigation faced by the plane maker over its 737 MAX jetliner.

title: Capital Question Clouds Deutsche Bank Merger Talks
summary: Deutsche Bank executives discussed requiring €8 billion for a tie-up with Commerzbank that was considered last year. One of the big questions surrounding Deutsche Bank AG's possible merger with Commerzbank AG is how much capital it might need to raise from shareholders to finance the deal.

title: Former NSA Contractor Pleads Guilty to Theft of Classified Documents
summary: Prosecutors agree to drop most counts against onetime contractor, who agrees to nine-year prison term. BALTIMORE-A former National Security Agency contractor pleaded guilty Thursday to illegally removing classified material from the agency's headquarters and agreed to a nine-year prison sentence.

title: Trump Reverses Proposal to End Special Olympics Funding
summary: 'I have overridden my people' on the controversial stance, president says. President Trump said Thursday he was reversing his administration's proposal to eliminate federal funding for the Special Olympics, a move that had drawn widespread criticism.

title: Trump Extends Temporary Protection for Liberians in U.S.
summary: Memorandum reverses course on fate of immigrants whose legal status was set to expire this month. WASHINGTON-President Trump is reversing course on the fate of thousands of Liberians in the U.S., days before a program shielding them from deportation was set to expire, setting up a fresh fight over the administration's immigration policy.

title: German Auto-Parts Maker to Buy Wabco Holdings for $7 Billion
summary: ZF Friedrichshafen's offer of $136.50 a share represents a 13% premium to Wabco's Feb. 26 closing price. Wabco Holdings Inc. said Thursday it agreed to be acquired by German car-parts maker ZF Friedrichshafen AG for roughly $7 billion, a 6.5% discount to Wabco's previous valuation.

title: Turkish Lira Plunges as Economic Pain Takes Hold
summary: Ahead of crucial local elections, the government has spent billions in reserves to try to prop up the currency. The Turkish lira dropped sharply for a second successive day on concerns the government was burning through foreign-exchange reserves, putting the spotlight on the country's shaky economic fundamentals ahead of crucial local elections.

title: Trump Taunts OPEC in Tweets as U.S. Officials Court the Cartel
summary: Most administrations avoid direct dealings with OPEC but the Trump administration has a new approach as it seeks to oust the cartel's Venezuelan leader. President Trump renewed his push for OPEC to lower oil prices on Thursday. But behind scenes the U.S. has opened a rare dialogue with the leadership of what many have long considered an illegal cartel.

title: 'Brexit Day' Is Here, but Britain Is Still Lost in a Maze
summary: Britain spent months preparing for what some dubbed "Independence Day" on March 29, but the real exit date is now hazier than ever. LONDON-Friday was meant to be the day the U.K. left the European Union, but British lawmakers are still lost in a Brexit maze.

title: Supreme Court Denies Attempt to Stop Bump-Stock Ban
summary: Justices maintain Trump administration gun control measure that came after massacres in Las Vegas, Florida. The Supreme Court on Thursday denied a bid from gun-rights advocates to temporarily halt the Trump administration's ban on rapid-fire bump stock devices like the ones used in the 2017 Las Vegas massacre.

title: Illinois Democrats Offer Relief From Deduction Cap, But Not Repeal
summary: Lawmakers who won GOP-held seats want to increase $10,000 cap on state and local tax deduction. WASHINGTON-Freshman Democrats from Illinois are pushing to relax the cap on the state and local tax deduction, offering a contrast to New York and New Jersey Democrats backing a full repeal that would disproportionately benefit the top 1% of households.

title: Former Yale Soccer Coach Pleads Guilty in College-Admissions Scheme
summary: Rudolph Meredith appeared in federal court in Boston Thursday afternoon. BOSTON-The former head women's soccer coach at Yale University pleaded guilty in federal court here Thursday for his role in the national college-admissions scandal, admitting to accepting nearly $900,000 in bribes to get students admitted to Yale under false pretenses.

title: State Street CIO Sparks Culture Change Around Problem-Solving
summary: Antoine Shagoury introduced 'design thinking' to shake up how the bank tests new ideas. State Street Corp.'s chief information officer is shaking up how the 227-year-old bank tests new ideas, an effort that has brought new services such as a chatbot for investors and a blockchain-based auditing system.

title: U.S. Stocks Rise as Investors Weigh Growth Concerns
summary: GDP data show U.S. growth slowed; 10-year Treasury yield holds below 2.4%. The S&P 500 wobbled but ended higher Thursday as investors continued to weigh whether recent concerns about global growth marked a blip in market sentiment or a longer-term turn away from the buoyancy that defined the beginning of 2019.

title: Trump, Congressional Republicans in Standoff Over Health Law
summary: Ahead of 2020, the president has been trying to persuade lawmakers to lead in the politically sensitive task of creating new health legislation. WASHINGTON-President Trump continued to reach out to Republican lawmakers Thursday to take the lead on crafting a health plan to replace the Affordable Care Act, working to hand off the politically sensitive effort ahead of the 2020 elections.

title: 'Dumbo': Bad News From the Big Top
summary: Tim Burton's live-action remake of the Disney classic is a three-ring circus of gloom.. Disney's new "Dumbo" is one ponderous pachyderm, a live-action remake of the 1941 animated classic with a grim tone and a dead soul. It's astounding that Tim Burton and his colleagues could have created such a downer from a long-beloved source of delight. (Yes, the original is blemished by a minstrel-show chorus of black crows that is now seen as the racist affront it always was, but the rest of the film remains a marvel of emotional intensity and narrative concision.) Instead of a fantasy about a baby elephant who defies the laws of gravity, "Dumbo" redux, which starts in Sarasota, Fla., in 1919, is a confirmation of Murphy's Law.

title: 'The Brink' Review: In the Mind of a Propagandist
summary: Alison Klayman's fly-on-the-wall documentary portrait of Steve Bannon follows him during the events surrounding the 2018 midterms.. 'The Brink" is Alison Klayman's revealing, fly-on-the-wall documentary portrait of Steve Bannon. The film is actually about two brinks, one of them clearly defined and the other not, though no less significant for its opacity.

title: 'Diane' Review: Burdens of a Caretaker
summary: The titular good Samaritan at the center of Kent Jones's debut fiction feature is generous to a self-destructive fault.. People reveal who they are when their features are in repose. The compulsive do-gooder at the center of "Diane" dispenses smiles and words of encouragement to the sick or dying friends she visits on her daily rounds. When there's no one to return her gentle gaze, though, her face falls into a sadness that amounts to a wasting disease. That may not sound like a great advertisement for this lovely first fiction feature by Kent Jones, but the first thing you should know is that Diane the heroine-no last name given or needed-is played by Mary Kay Place, who was wonderful on TV in "Mary Hartman, Mary Hartman" more than four decades ago, and is wonderful here in new and affecting ways. The second thing you should know is that "Diane" the movie is populated by people we seldom see in mainstream films, so seldom that we may not remember the pleasure we've been missing.

title: Law Firm Wins $55 Million Settlement in 401(k) Fee Suit
summary: St. Louis-based firm that pioneered litigation targeting retirement-plan fees said it has secured $446 million for clients since 2010. The law firm that helped pioneer 401(k)-fee lawsuits against big companies more than a decade ago announced a $55 million settlement on Thursday against ABB Inc., a company with U.S. headquarters in Cary, N.C., that specializes in areas including power grids and robotics.

title: U.S. Treasury Prices Ease
summary: The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury note settles at 2.389%. U.S. government-bond prices eased lower Thursday as the market took a breather from a multiday rally that has heightened worries about the outlook for the U.S. economy.

title: Bank of Mexico Leaves Interest Rates Unchanged
summary: Central bank stops short of ruling out rate increases down the road. MEXICO CITY-The Bank of Mexico left interest rates unchanged Thursday but stopped short of ruling out additional rate increases given risks to its goal of getting inflation down to 3%.

title: Measles Outbreak Grows to 214 Cases in New York City
summary: Most of the illness has surfaced in Orthodox Jewish communities in Brooklyn's Williamsburg and Borough Park. New York City's worst measles outbreak in decades continues to grow in the Orthodox Jewish community, where some families have resisted vaccinating their children, health officials said.

title: Puerto Rico Oversight Board Members Win White House Support
summary: Trump administration prepares to seek Senate confirmation of current oversight board members instead of picking new ones. The White House is preparing to ask the Senate to confirm the current members of Puerto Rico's oversight board, according to people familiar with the matter, a move that would disappoint critics of the U.S. territory's financial supervisors.

title: Deutsche Bank Plans New Electronic Stock-Trading Venture
summary: German bank will trade U.S. stocks directly with large clients on a new platform. Deutsche Bank AG said it plans to launch a new electronic platform where it will trade U.S. stocks directly with large clients, instead of matching buyers and sellers for a fee like Wall Street banks typically do.

title: 'The Twilight Zone': A Dimension Short of Imagination
summary: The latest reboot of the sci-fi classic has a strong cast, but is overlong, very dreary, and too reliant on the series that came before it.. Jordan Peele doesn't smirk, exactly, while serving as host to the re-re-rebooted "Twilight Zone." But there's a twinkle in his eye, and the distinct sense that he knows-and knows that we know he knows-that he's on a fool's errand. You can't recapture the past. You can't recapture the mystique of Rod Serling's original show. And, if you try, the faithful will make unhappy comparisons.

title: 'Tigerland' Review: Species of Different Stripes
summary: Ross Kauffman's documentary looks at the big cats and the humans that pass through their world.. One of the many striking things about Ross Kauffman's documentary "Tigerland" is how firmly it puts nature filmmaking in its place. Not a bad place. But the point of much wildlife cinema is not just to exalt and celebrate animals but to make them surrogates in humanized drama. It can make for very effective television, even a tool for conservation. But it also Disneyfies the beast.

title: Purdue's Sackler Family Accused of Fraud in Transfers of Opioid Profits
summary: Amended complaint argues Purdue profits paid to owners should be clawed back because of mounting lawsuits against the company. Members of the Sackler family who control OxyContin-maker Purdue Pharma LP allegedly used a web of corporate entities to transfer funds from the company to themselves, moves the New York attorney general says were fraudulent, on the basis that the company was already insolvent or close to it.

title: Lawmakers Call for Termination of NSA Domestic Surveillance Program
summary: Bill seeks to spark debate about surveillance before parts of Patriot Act, which authorizes phone-call and text-message data collection, expire this year. A bipartisan group of lawmakers introduced legislation on Thursday to end the National Security Agency's practice of collecting records of Americans' phone calls and text messages, a push that comes amid uncertainty about the fate of the surveillance program.

title: FP&L to Build World's Largest Solar-Powered Battery System
summary: Utility company says it will be four times larger than any existing battery. Florida Power & Light said it plans to build the world's largest battery, which would collect electricity from solar panels during the day and discharge it as needed during periods of high power demand.

title: Verizon Expands Diversity-and-Inclusion Push With New Focus on Retention
summary: Marketers evolve their tactics to improve diversity in advertising. Verizon Communications Inc. will study employee retention among women and people of color working in advertising and media, the company said.

title: Oil Slides After Trump Calls for Increased OPEC Supply
summary: Cartel and its partners divided on extending production caps beyond June. • U.S. crude-oil prices fell for the fourth time in five sessions Thursday, pulling back after President Trump resumed his calls for higher OPEC production and lower crude prices.

title: Saudi Women Activists Released on Bail
summary: Two women who sought to secure women driving rights and another detainee let out; trial to continue. Saudi Arabia released on bail three women's activists facing charges for their human-rights work and contacts with foreign journalists and diplomats in a case that became a global symbol of a political crackdown under Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

title: Gold Falls With Dollar Surging
summary: Prices are up slightly in 2019; copper edges up.. Gold prices slid Thursday, hurt by a stronger dollar after a second reading of U.S. fourth-quarter economic growth was in line with analyst expectations.

title: FDA Commissioner Calls for Tighter Standard for Approval of New Opioids
summary: Painkillers should show advantages over existing drugs, Gottlieb says. WASHINGTON-Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Scott Gottlieb is proposing that the agency take the novel step of approving new opioid painkillers only if they show comparative advantages over existing drugs in reducing pain or enhancing safety.

title: 'Hollar's Encyclopedic Eye: Prints From the Frank Raysor Collection' Review: A Master Who Copied Masters
summary: Hollar was so celebrated for his beautiful and authentic renditions that he was entrusted not only with making copies of others' artworks but also with chronicling places and making maps..

title: NATO Extends Leader's Tenure
summary: Alliance leader will meet with President Trump in Washington next week and address a joint session of Congress. BRUSSELS-NATO said Thursday it had extended until 2022 the mandate of Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg, who has won praise from the Trump administration for his efforts encouraging allies to spend more on defense.

title: U.S. Economy Had Less Momentum Heading Into 2019 as Corporate Profits Stalled
summary: Spending by consumers, state and local governments and businesses was revised lower. WASHINGTON-The U.S. economy finished the year on a softer note than previously estimated, and new data shows corporate-profit growth stalled, pointing to weak momentum at the start of 2019.

title: Vale Cites Sales Impact of Dam Disaster
summary: Brazilian miner expects flat sales volumes this year as it focuses on safety, not production. SÃO PAULO-Iron-ore mining giant Vale SA said its main focus after the Brumadinho dam disaster is on safety rather than restoring production, and that the tragedy could cut its sales volume by as much as 75 million metric tons this year.

title: Best-Selling Books Week Ended March 23
summary: With data from NPD BookScan.

title: WOW Air Flights Canceled as Budget Airline Collapses
summary: Failure of Iceland carrier that specialized in U.S.-Europe travel, adds to string of overseas long-distance budget airlines that have faltered recently. Icelandic low-cost carrier WOW Air, which specialized in linking cities in the U.S. with European destinations, has collapsed, adding to a string of airlines overseas that have faltered in recent months amid stiff competition and rising costs.

title: 'Juno and the Paycock' Review: Money Won't Solve Their Problems
summary: The second work in Seán O'Casey's 'Dublin Trilogy,' which is being performed in full by the Irish Repertory Theatre this season, follows a braggart and his suffering wife who receive an unexpected inheritance..

title: Finally, I Can Win My Battle Against Kale
summary: It turns out that nasty pesticides cling to it. Science is now with me against the vile stuff.. I was having lunch with old friends last Sunday when one of them mentioned that kale had just been named to a prestigious list of the world's most pesticide-laden foods.

title: Democrats Pick Miami for First Presidential Primary Debate
summary: As many as 20 candidates could take the stage over two nights in June. WASHINGTON-The Democrats' first televised presidential primary debates will be held June 26-27 in Miami, the Democratic National Committee said Thursday.

title: WTO Rules U.S. Has Failed to Eliminate Illegal Aid for Boeing
summary: Ruling brings EU closer to imposing retaliatory tariffs. The World Trade Organization Thursday handed the European Union a victory in a protracted trade battle with the U.S. over plane subsidies given to Boeing Co. , moving the EU closer to imposing potentially large retaliatory tariffs.

title: Swedbank Ousts CEO Amid Money-Laundering Scandal
summary: Birgitte Bonnesen's removal follows the resignation of Danske Bank's chief executive in September. STOCKHOLM- Swedbank AB fired its chief executive Thursday, a day after Swedish police raided the banking giant's headquarters as part of a widening money-laundered scandal involving billions of dollars of suspicious money, mostly from Russia.

title: Nineteen Dead After Dhaka Office Tower Erupts in Flames, Trapping Workers Inside
summary: Authorities warn that death toll could rise after blaze rips through 22-story building. DHAKA, Bangladesh-Nineteen people died when fire erupted in an office tower in Bangladesh's capital, Dhaka, on Thursday afternoon, sending flames up the 22-floor building and trapping dozens of workers inside for hours.

title: Treasury to Sell $84 Billion in Debt
summary: U.S. Treasury Department plans to auction next week 13- and 26-week bills. The U.S. Treasury Department will auction $84 billion in securities next week. Details (both with minimum denominations of $100):

title: A Preppy-Chic Beach Holiday in Spain
summary: Inspired by coastal California, Sotogrande was bred for the good life. Here's where to sleep, golf, eat and take in the polo matches in Spain's most glamorous seaside spot. SOTOGRANDE LIES just 15 miles from Gibraltar, near the southernmost tip of Spain. But driving past the bougainvillea hedges bordering sprawling villas, compulsively groomed golf courses and polo fields, you might easily mistake this coastal enclave for one in California. In this cultivated environment, Bentleys, yachts and other trappings of wealth have a habit of turning up, which was the whole idea when Sotogrande was born in the 1960s as the dream of one man, Joseph McMicking, born Jose Rafael McMicking y Ynchausti.

title: Russia Defies U.S. Calls to Get Out of Venezuela
summary: Moscow's support for President Maduro has added another layer of tension between Russia and the U.S.. MOSCOW-Russia hit back against U.S. warnings over its support for Venezuela's government, defending its arms trade with the Latin American country and promising to keep its military advisers there as long as President Nicolás Maduro deemed necessary.

title: Three Pemex Board Members to Resign Over Policy Differences
summary: Independent advisers object to López Obrador administration's plans, clearing the way for tighter government control over the state-oil company. MEXICO CITY-Three independent board members of state-run Petróleos Mexicanos are set to resign over discord with President Andrés Manuel López Obrador's strategy for managing the troubled oil firm, say people with knowledge of the situation.

title: J&J to Air First TV Ad for Drug That Discloses Its Price
summary: New spot for bloodthinner Xarelto will show a list price of $448 a month, the first television ad containing a drug's list price. Johnson & Johnson plans to start airing the first U.S. television commercial for a prescription drug that discloses how much it costs, a nod toward rising political pressure over prices.

title: Another Money Manager Is Joining the Race to Zero
summary: Dallas-based Westwood Holdings Group won't charge fees for new account unless it beats the market. A Dallas money manager is launching an investment account that won't charge fees unless it beats the market, joining a broader reduction in the price of investing as firms duel for increasingly cost-conscious clients.

title: Free School Breakfasts Without Stigma
summary: A behavioral economist answers questions about subsidized meals, security measures and visiting friends. Hi, Dan.

title: Floods Deal New Blow to Farm Belt
summary: Farmers, agricultural companies face losses as water swamps fields and transit networks. Severe flooding in the Midwest is damaging fields, disrupting shipments and dealing a costly blow to growers and agribusinesses as a downturn in the farm economy stretches into a sixth year.

title: House GOP Members Demand Intel Chairman Schiff's Resignation
summary: Members cite Adam Schiff's past comments regarding President Trump's campaign and Russia. Mr. Schiff countered forcefully.. WASHINGTON-All nine Republican members of the House Intelligence Committee called on the panel's Democratic chairman to resign on Thursday, the latest sign of bitter partisan feuding following Special Counsel Robert Mueller's finding of no conspiracy between President Trump's 2016 campaign and Russia.

title: The Surprising Stories Behind 8 Famous Fashion Logos

Mr. Lacoste didn't end up getting a suitcase, but the story led an American journalist to nickname him "The Alligator." An image of a toothy predator was affixed to his signature polos.

title: The Malibu House That Was Prepared for One of the State's Worst Wildfires
summary: Phillip Vogt packed his new dream estate with five bedrooms, a wine library-and every fire-safe feature he could think of. Then the Woolsey Fire came.. On the morning of Nov. 9, Phillip Vogt got a phone call. The person on the other end said he wouldn't be able to make their appointment at Mr. Vogt's home because the roads leading there were blocked by California Highway Patrol. It was then that Mr. Vogt looked out his window: The hillsides surrounding his home had been consumed by a wildfire moving at breakneck speed.

title: SEC Grants $50 Million Award to Two JPMorgan Whistleblowers
summary: One of the tipsters received $37 million, the third-largest award in the history of the agency's whistleblower program. Two whistleblowers received a total of $50 million for providing information that helped the Securities and Exchange Commission pursue a case of corporate wrongdoing, the agency said Tuesday.

title: Deus Ex Machina: Religions Use Robots to Connect With the Public
summary: The 15th century had the printing press. Today, a handful of religious institutions are developing interactive machines to share doctrine and converse with the faithful. Gabriele Trovato is worried about tomorrow. That's what he confesses to SanTO, a robot. Just shy of 17 inches tall, SanTO resembles the small figurines of saints often found in Catholic homes-except with a computer, microphone, sensors and a facial recognition-enabled camera. As Mr. Trovato speaks to the machine, its deep, echoing voice responds with a Bible quote: "From the Gospel according to Matthew," it says, "do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own."

title: Will Truckers Trade Futures? A New Market Seeks to Draw Freight Bets

The first futures tied to the cost of trucking goods across the U.S. are set to launch on Friday, testing whether an old-school industry will embrace a new financial tool designed to protect cargo haulers and shippers against swings in freight rates.

title: Daimler, Geely Deepen Bond With Electric City-Car Venture

title: Food Infused With Cannabis Extract Takes a Hit
summary: CBD is now used in a prescription drug, putting it off limits for food and drinks under federal law. A derivative of the marijuana plant known as CBD is surging in popularity as an ingredient in food and drinks, but the fledgling industry faces an unusual complication: CBD, or cannabidiol, is now also a prescription drug.

title: Aramco Plans $10 Billion Bond, Casting Light on Its Finances
summary: Money raised will be used to help fund its $69 billion purchase of a stake in Saudi Arabia's petrochemicals firm. DUBAI-Saudi Aramco plans to issue a $10 billion bond as early as next week to help fund its acquisition of a majority stake in Saudi Arabia's petrochemicals firm, people familiar with the matter said, shining a light on the financial performance of the world's largest oil company for the first time.

title: Amazon to Expand Tech Hub in Austin
summary: Company plans 800 new tech jobs and will move to a larger facility. Amazon.com Inc. said it plans to add 800 new technology jobs to its tech hub in Austin, Texas, expanding in a city that was on its short list for its second headquarters.

title: A Day in the Life of the Beauty Industry's Main Disruptor
summary: Moj Mahdara, CEO of the digitally savvy brand Beautycon, is changing up the industry one festival at a time. On an overcast morning in January, Moj Mahdara stands in front of a 6-foot-tall fiberglass unicorn that's painted a potent Lisa Frank pink. Experiential commerce "is our business model moving forward," says the CEO of the event-driven company Beautycon, as she reaches down to pick up handfuls of silver confetti and throws them into the air. Beautycon Pop, the company's most recent venture, is a Los Angeles pop-up that features eight photogenic rooms (half of which are sponsored by partners like Macy's and Korean skin-care brand Laneige), a stage for guest speakers and a shop highlighting products from female-founded brands. Under Mahdara, 41, Beautycon, which launched in 2011 as a gathering of YouTube beauty creators, has transformed into a data-driven juggernaut with celebrity tie-ins and a platform for propelling small brands to commercial success. This month, the fifth annual Beautycon Festival New York arrives at the Javits Center in Manhattan (after holding events in London, Dubai and Dallas, the company now focuses on its flagship festivals in New York and Los Angeles). Its 13,000 tickets are expected to sell out, and a Cardi B talk is headlining the weekend's events. In a climate where brick-and-mortar retailers desperately dangle free champagne and influencer talks in front of shoppers to get them in the door, Beautycon festivals do $4,200 per square foot in compounded sales.

title: Tracking Moj Mahdara

title: Boeing, Garuda Move Closer to Resolving 737 MAX Cancellation Request
summary: Indonesian flag carrier says it won't change airplane makers but will ask Boeing to switch order to other planes. JAKARTA, Indonesia- Boeing Co. and PT Garuda Indonesia moved closer Thursday to resolving the airline's request to alter or cancel a longstanding order for 737 MAX jets following the aircraft model's two recent crashes, with one option being to switch to different planes, Garuda's chief executive said.

title: The Revolution That Wasn't: Disillusioned Ukrainians Head to Polls
summary: Frustrated with graft, their inability to join NATO and the EU and a conflict with Russia, voters make a politically inexperienced comedian their top candidate. Europe and the West would pull the country into their orbit, reviving a long-suffering economy, they hoped.

title: Trump Asks OPEC to 'Increase the Flow of Oil'
summary: President says oil prices are getting too high and world markets are fragile. WASHINGTON-President Trump on Thursday said oil prices have risen too high and called on the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries to do its part to mitigate the price increase.

title: Malta Seizes Merchant Ship Hijacked by Migrants
summary: Migrants hijacked the ship and steered it toward Malta when they realized they were being taken back to Libya; at least three were arrested. Maltese special forces seized control of a merchant ship on Thursday after it was commandeered by migrants who refused to be taken back to Libya, in a sign of the continuing migration tensions in the Mediterranean Sea as Europe cracks down on migration.

title: Divided House Democrats Struggle to Write a Budget Blueprint

summary: Verdict is second trial loss for Bayer's Monsanto unit over Roundup safety. A jury Wednesday awarded $80.3 million in damages to a California resident the jurors found contracted cancer from exposure to Bayer AG's Roundup weedkillers.
